name: B. Far Relative’s Problem
statement:
Famil Door wants to celebrate his birthday with his friends from Far Far
Away. He has friends and each of them can come to the party in a
specific range of days of the year from to . Of course, Famil Door wants
to have as many friends celebrating together with him as possible.Far
cars are as weird as Far Far Away citizens, so they can only carry two
people of opposite gender, that is exactly one male and one female.
However, Far is so far from here that no other transportation may be
used to get to the party.Famil Door should select some day of the year
and invite some of his friends, such that they all are available at this
moment and the number of male friends invited is equal to the number of
female friends invited. Find the maximum number of friends that may
present at the party.
editorial:
Consider that we have males in the day of the year and females in the
day of the year. These arrays can be filled easily when you are reading
the input (See the code). Then for the day of the year, we could have *
( , ) people which could come to the party. The answer would be maximum
of this value between all days () Time Complexity: (*) C++ Solution
Bonus: Try to solve this problem with (). For each interval given in the
input, you donât need to iterate from day to day . This idea is used to
solve problem 276C.
